meta.investigationSummary: Deep investigation completed 2026-02-08. Findings: (1) hack/run-on-windows.sh has TODO about dodgy sed escaping, uses 'powershell' not 'pwsh', perl filter correctness is dubious, base64 cross-platform issues; (2) eventloop/Makefile has 25+ hardcoded absolute paths /Users/joeyc/dev/go-utilpkg/eventloop; (3) IOCP poller has 5 skipped test stubs + dispatchEvents holds RLock during callback execution (violates own comment); (4) goja-eventloop has 8 NEEDS POLYFILL skips (ES2021-2023) + 22 Intl skips; (5) eventloop has 83 t.Skip calls (most are short-mode guards, 5 are thenStandalone compliance, 1 is Promise.All race condition bug, 3 are ID exhaustion infeasible-to-test); (6) go.work covers all 21 go.mod files; (7) internal/ has 8 subdirs (alternateone/two/three, promisealtone/two/three/four, promisetournament) within tournament module.

globalAlerts.alert: ON TOOLS: Use `config.mk` to create custom targets to run with Make. ALWAYS use custom targets that *limit* the amount of output you receive. For example, piping through tail, with FEW lines output. Prior to tail, pipe to tee. The file ./build.log in the root of the project is gitignored, so use that. That way you can *search* the output. To be clear, timing dependent tests are BANNED. As are those that take too long to run. Testing retries, for example, MUST be done in a way that supports avoiding running afoul of those CRITICAL rules. Abide. OBEY.

mandatoryDirectives.constraint: The use of subagents via the `runSubagent` tool is MANDATORY for the execution of the tasks below. Tasks are grouped specifically to be run in distinct subagent contexts to prevent context window exhaustion. Do not attempt to solve all groups in a single turn.

statusSection.currentState: INVESTIGATION COMPLETE. 55 flat sequential tasks defined. Ready for execution.

sequentialTasks.title: Baseline macOS gmake all validation
sequentialTasks.description: Run `gmake make-all-with-log` on macOS to establish current baseline. Search build.log for FAIL to identify all current failures. This determines what is broken vs working before any changes.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: build.log exists and has been analyzed. All FAIL lines cataloged in deviationLog.

sequentialTasks.title: Fix eventloop/Makefile hardcoded absolute paths
sequentialTasks.description: eventloop/Makefile has 25+ occurrences of hardcoded `/Users/joeyc/dev/go-utilpkg/eventloop`. Every target uses `cd /Users/joeyc/dev/go-utilpkg/eventloop &&` which must become just `.` or use no cd at all (Makefile already runs in its own directory). The `grep -r` in test-promise-race-comprehensive also uses the absolute path. Replace ALL occurrences. The Makefile should work when the repo is cloned anywhere.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: `grep -r '/Users/joeyc' eventloop/Makefile` returns zero results. `gmake -C eventloop test-wakeup-integration` works from project root.

sequentialTasks.title: Fix hack/run-on-windows.sh sed injection TODO
sequentialTasks.description: Line 70 has `TODO I'm quite sure the escaping here is dodgy...`. The sed command `sed 's|__ARGS_B64__|$ARGS_B64|'` uses `|` as delimiter. Base64 output charset is A-Za-z0-9+/= which cannot contain `|`, `&`, or `\` (sed special chars). The injection is actually safe. Remove the TODO and add a comment explaining why it's safe (base64 charset guarantees).
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: TODO comment removed. Explanatory comment added noting base64 charset (A-Za-z0-9+/=) is safe with `|` delimiter and contains no sed special chars.

sequentialTasks.title: Fix hack/run-on-windows.sh PowerShell version inconsistency
sequentialTasks.description: Script REQUIREMENTS header says 'PowerShell 7 (default shell)' but REMOTE_WRAPPER uses `powershell` (v5.1). The script actually works fine with PS 5.1 - all APIs used ([Guid]::NewGuid(), [System.Convert]::FromBase64String, [System.Diagnostics.Process]) are available in 5.1+. Update the REQUIREMENTS header to say 'PowerShell 5.1+ (powershell or pwsh)' to match reality.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: REQUIREMENTS header accurately says 'PowerShell 5.1+'. Comment near REMOTE_WRAPPER is consistent.

sequentialTasks.title: Validate hack/run-on-windows.sh perl filter correctness
sequentialTasks.description: Line 208: `perl -0ne 'print if -e'`. The `-0` flag sets input record separator to NUL, so each NUL-delimited filename becomes `$_`. `-e` tests if file exists. `print` outputs `$_` which includes the trailing NUL. Verify this preserves NUL-delimited output for downstream `tar --null -T -`. Test locally: `printf 'Makefile\0nonexistent\0README.md\0' | perl -0ne 'print if -e' | od -c` should show NUL bytes between output filenames.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: Perl filter verified to correctly preserve NUL-delimited output via local test. If broken, fix documented.

sequentialTasks.title: Validate hack/run-on-windows.sh base64 cross-platform safety
sequentialTasks.description:
Script uses `base64 | tr -d '
'` for encoding. macOS `base64` and Linux `base64` both wrap at 76 chars, both stripped by `tr -d '
'`. The remote side uses WSL `base64 -d` (GNU coreutils handles multi-line). Verify `printf 'test\0arg' | base64 | tr -d '
'` works identically on macOS. The ARGS_B64 and payload encoding should be robust.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: Cross-platform base64 encoding verified. No functional change needed if validated.

sequentialTasks.title: Validate hack/run-on-windows.sh git ls-files behavior
sequentialTasks.description: `git ls-files -c -o --exclude-standard -z` includes tracked files (-c) and untracked non-ignored files (-o). Perl filter removes ghost files (tracked but deleted). go.work IS included. No submodules in this repo. This is correct for the use case. Document this validation.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: Behavior documented as correct in script comments or blueprint.

sequentialTasks.title: Verify go.work completeness against all go.mod files
sequentialTasks.description: 21 go.mod files exist across the workspace. go.work has 22 `use` entries (root + 21). Cross-reference every go.mod with go.work entries. Run `go work sync` to validate.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: Every go.mod has a corresponding go.work `use` entry. `go work sync` succeeds.

sequentialTasks.title: Verify module replace directives and go mod tidy
sequentialTasks.description: goja-eventloop/go.mod uses `replace github.com/joeycumines/go-eventloop => ../eventloop`. eventloop/internal/tournament/go.mod and gojabaseline/go.mod likely have replace directives too. Verify all are correct. Run `go mod tidy` in eventloop/, goja-eventloop/, internal modules.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: `go mod tidy` succeeds for all modules without changes.

sequentialTasks.title: Fix IOCP poller dispatchEvents callback-under-lock bug
sequentialTasks.description: poller_windows.go dispatchEvents() comment says 'Callback is copied under lock then called outside' but code executes `cb(p.fds[fd].events)` INSIDE `defer p.fdMu.RUnlock()` scope. Darwin/Linux pollers correctly copy callbacks under lock and execute outside. Fix: copy callback and events under RLock, release lock, then call callback. This prevents deadlock if callback calls RegisterFD/UnregisterFD.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: dispatchEvents copies callback+events under RLock, releases lock, then calls callback. Comment matches implementation. Existing tests still pass.

sequentialTasks.title: Evaluate and clean up 5 IOCP skipped test stubs
sequentialTasks.description: 5 tests in poller_windows_test.go are Skip stubs: TestIOCPBasicSocketIO, TestIOCPTimerFunctionality, TestIOCPMultipleFDs, TestIOCPStressTest, TestIOCPOverlappedIO. TestIOCPTimerFunctionality is redundant (timers are platform-independent). The other 4 require full overlapped I/O. Decision: delete TestIOCPTimerFunctionality (dead test). Keep or improve skip messages for remaining 4 as documented future work.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: Each stub either deleted with justification or has improved skip message clearly explaining it's a future-work placeholder.

sequentialTasks.title: Fix IOCP poller Init() wrong error for double-init
sequentialTasks.description: FastPoller.Init() returns `ErrFDAlreadyRegistered` for double-initialization with comment 'Using existing error for already initialized'. This is semantically wrong. Check darwin/linux pollers for consistency. Either define a new error or use a different existing one.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: Init() returns a semantically correct error. Consistent across all platform pollers.

sequentialTasks.title: Validate cross-platform poller API surface consistency
sequentialTasks.description: Compare exported methods and types between poller_windows.go, poller_darwin.go, poller_linux.go. All must implement: Init, Close, RegisterFD, UnregisterFD, ModifyFD, PollIO, Wakeup. Verify IOEvents, IOCallback, event constants, maxFDs, MaxFDLimit, and error variables are consistent. Check no duplicate error definitions between poller files and errors.go/loop.go.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: All three pollers implement identical API surface. No duplicate error definitions.

sequentialTasks.title: Fix Promise.All race condition bug
sequentialTasks.description: TestPromiseAll_AlreadySettledPromises is skipped: 'exposes race condition bug in All() implementation where fulfillment can win over rejection when promises are already settled'. This is a real bug. When all input promises are already settled and one is rejected, rejection should win per spec but fulfillment can win. Investigate All() in promise.go, identify the race, fix it, unskip the test.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: TestPromiseAll_AlreadySettledPromises unskipped and passes. All other Promise.All tests still pass. Race detector clean.

sequentialTasks.title: Evaluate thenStandalone compliance skips
sequentialTasks.description: 5 tests in promise_js_integration_test.go skip with 'thenStandalone is not Promise/A+ compliant'. Determine if thenStandalone is intentionally non-compliant (performance path) or needs fixing. If intentional, document limitations in godoc. If ThenWithJS is the recommended compliant API, make that clear.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: Decision documented. Skip rationale is clear and consistent.

sequentialTasks.title: Evaluate ID exhaustion test skips
sequentialTasks.description: 3 tests in js_integration_error_paths_test.go skip for ID exhaustion (SetImmediate, SetTimeout, SetInterval). All say 'Requires mocking atomic counter or running >2^53'. Evaluate if test infrastructure should be added (e.g., inject counter near MAX_SAFE_INTEGER) or if skips are acceptable.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: Decision documented. Either test infrastructure added and tests unskipped, OR skip rationale improved.

sequentialTasks.title: Run eventloop tests with race detector on macOS
sequentialTasks.description: Run `go test -race -timeout=6m ./eventloop/...` and capture results. Check for any data race reports. Known race-targeted tests: race_test.go, loop_race_test.go, fastpath_race_test.go, poller_race_test.go, metrics_race_test.go, promisify_shutdown_race_test.go, js_interval_race_coverage_test.go.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: Zero data race reports. All tests pass with -race flag.

sequentialTasks.title: Validate goroutine leak detection tests
sequentialTasks.description: Run leak_test.go and js_leak_test.go specifically. These verify no goroutines are leaked after loop shutdown. Ensure these don't have timing dependencies. Run 3x for stability.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: All leak tests pass consistently (3x). No goroutine leaks detected.

sequentialTasks.title: Validate Loop lifecycle and shutdown tests
sequentialTasks.description: Run lifecycle_test.go, shutdown_test.go, loop_edge_cases_test.go. Verify New() -> Run() -> Shutdown() -> Terminated. Double-shutdown must be safe.
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: All lifecycle tests pass. Double-shutdown doesn't panic.

sequentialTasks.title: Validate state machine tests
sequentialTasks.description: Run statemachine_test.go, state_machine_simple_test.go, state_coverage_test.go. Verify CAS-based state transitions and cache-line padding (align_test.go, align_darwin_test.go).
sequentialTasks.verificationCriteria: All state machine tests pass. Cache line alignment verified.

sequentialTasks.description: Run all timer tests: timer_pool_test.go, timer_cancel_test.go, timer_batch_cancel_test.go, timer_deadlock_test.go, timerheap_edge_case_test.go, timer_id_exhaustion_test.go, timer_coverage_test.go, timer_html5_compliance_test.go.

continuousVerification.task: Run 'make all' with full logging after EVERY significant change
continuousVerification.description: Execute 'make make-all-with-log' after: (a) Each code change, (b) Each test addition, (c) Each task completion, (d) Each bug fix.
continuousVerification.failPolicy: If ANY test fails, STOP IMMEDIATELY and fix the issue before proceeding. Zero tolerance for test failures, timing issues, non-determinism, or race conditions.
continuousVerification.testCoverage: You will ALWAYS aim for 100% effective test coverage, and VERIFY test coverage by means of the tooling available to you. You will NOT proceed to the next task until you have achieved 100% effective test coverage for the current task, and have verified that coverage with the tools available to you.

To be clear, timing dependent tests are BANNED. As are those that take too long to run. Testing retries, for example, MUST be done in a way that supports avoiding running afoul of those CRITICAL rules. Abide. OBEY.
